title: Supply of Scientific Man-power in the United States
The Defense Medical Supply Center and the Suppliers
Double Nerve Supply of Krause Corpuscles at the Human Corneal Limbus
Water Supply Economics in the Potomac River Basin
items.abstract: <jats:p>This article discusses a proposal released in February of 1963 by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers for a $500 million system of water storage projects in the Potomac River Basin. Topics discussed include: the impact of alternative pricing policies on the nature and solution of the anticipated water supply problems and the resulting implications for economic efficiency; questions concerning the best regional plan for outdoor recreation that stem from the plan's major investment in recreation facilities; the cost of meeting water quality standards related to low flow augmentation; the inadequate state of technical resources to deal with water quality issues and water resources planning; and, uncertainty about how modifying the current standard might affect the costs and benefits of quality improvement programs.</jats:p>

title: Blood Supply of the Temporomandibular Joint
Evocation of regrowth phenomena in anuran limbs by electrical stimulation of the nerve supply
items.abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>Experiments reveal that growth reactions may be evoked in amputated forelimbs of fully adult <jats:italic>Rana pipiens</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>R. catesbiana</jats:italic> by electrical stimulation of the normal limb nerve supply. The evoked growths were generally small cones, 5–10 mm in length; none developed into limbs of normal size and morphology, but some formed digits and cartilage and developed striated muscle. The combined influences of trauma, effected by salt treatment, and electrical stimulation of the nerve produced more growths than trauma or stimulation alone.</jats:p>

title: Spartina Salt Marshes in Southern England: III. Rates of Establishment, Succession and Nutrient Supply at Bridgwater Bay, Somerset
Current Regulator for a 10 000-A dc 7.5-MW Magnet Power Supply
items.abstract: <jats:p>Design and construction details are discussed for a dc current control system capable of a short term stability of a few parts in 106 and a long term stability of ∼2 parts in 105 when used in conjunction with conventional rotating dc generators powering loads with time constants of approximately 200 msec at levels up to 7.5 MW. Actual performance of the system at various power levels is discussed.</jats:p>

title: Induction Motor Operation under Variation of Supply Frequency

title: Effect of hypercapnia on the blood supply to the heart in chronic experimental conditions

title: THE ONTARIO SHORT RUN MILK SUPPLY CURVE1
container-title: Canadian Journal of Agricultural Economics/Revue canadienne d'agroeconomie
items.abstract: <jats:p>This article reviews the idea and usefulness of a short run supply schedule for an agricultural commodity and goes on to explain the method used in the case of commercially produced milk in Ontario for the calendar year 1959. The results are compared with those from other studies, and their economic significance is discussed, particularly the relation between excess capacity, income distribution under multiple‐price‐quota systems, and technical progress in the Ontario dairy producers' industry.</jats:p>
